Welcome to TBD’s documentation!¶

This is a program to display simulation data from finite difference calculations.

Usage¶

Call main.py -h for a little help.

With the provided example data in the programs main directory, a viable command would be

main.py -d example_data.

This would start the backend, which in turn would look for simulation data in the directory example_data. A web server would also be started. This we could reach at http://localhost:8008.

Indices and tables¶

  • Index
  • Module Index
  • Search Page
grabCanvas(canvasElementName)¶

Try to find a HTML5 canvas element. If found, try to assign it a WebGL2 context. If this fails throw an error, else return the context.

Arguments:
  • canvasElementName (string) – The HTML5 canvas element.
Throws:

error – Error: No WebGL2
Returns:

context – gl - The WebGL2 context.
